title: ICT-Utilized Language Education Design Workshop: Online Resource-Based Integrated Vocabulary·Expression·Grammar Learning Strategies for Middle-Aged and Elderly Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, language education experience, and foundational understanding of grammar, vocabulary, and reading comprehension
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, with offline sessions utilizing local resources like public libraries to emphasize integrated reading-writing activities. Focuses on comprehensively improving learners' communication skills, expressive abilities, reading comprehension, and writing skills.

learning_goals: Learners can identify ≥5 free/low-cost online resources (podcasts, MOOCs, etc.) suitable for language education and explain methods to analyze their vocabulary/grammar structures and text types.

Learners design ≥2 integrated listening-speaking language learning activities using smartphone tools (audio recorders, translation apps, etc.) and evaluate pronunciation accuracy and expressive fluency.

Within 4 weeks, learners select ≥3 open-source educational materials free of copyright issues and complete a blended learning design (30% online + 70% offline). They achieve "Excellent" ratings in ≥4 of 5 project evaluation rubric items (grammar accuracy, vocabulary diversity, communication skills, reading accuracy, writing creativity).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
